intro: Blumea senegalensis, commonly known as African blue sage, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties. The plant's ability to withstand drought conditions makes it an important component of its ecosystem.
